titleStmt.title: Gertrude Bugler to Thomas Hardy — Thanks for birthday books, 8 March 1925

publicationStmt.p: Unpublished autograph note held at the Dorset History Centre / Dorset Museum, MS H.1543.

support.p: Small bifolium of pale grey wove paper, written in violet-blue ink; deckled top edge; light rust staining at inner margin; verso sides largely blank.

layout.p: Short two-part message across first recto and final page; closing and signature on the final page.

handNote.p: Neat upright cursive in violet aniline ink; open letterforms; occasional long descenders; steady baselines.

msDesc.note: Possibly blind-embossed heading of residence (faint); no printed letterhead clearly legible.
Pencilled date “1925.” and “March 8” at upper right of first page by later hand; shelfmark “H.1543” pencilled on verso.

abstract.p: Gertrude Bugler thanks Thomas Hardy for sending Woodlanders for her birthday and says she will always value the books; she is glad he is not annoyed with her about the Haymarket matinees.

note.p: Gertrude Bugler (1900–1997), Dorset actor associated with stage productions of Hardy’s works, writes regarding birthday gifts and mentions “Haymarket Matinees,” referring to performances at the Theatre Royal, London.

div.p: I thank you very sincerely for sending the Woodlanders for my birthday; it is useless for me to try to tell you how much I shall always value my three beautiful books.
I am so very glad too to know that you are not annoyed with me about the Haymarket Matinees.
